Dear BNL Students and Parents,

Due to the pandemic, Bedford North Lawrence will have to cancel the 2020 Prom. We held out on canceling for as long as we could, knowing that Prom is a significant event in our students' lives, and we wanted to do everything we could to preserve the tradition. Unfortunately, we do not see how this can be accomplished in the current state of the pandemic.

NLCS is working with the Lawrence County Health Dept. and making modifications to our graduation plan as needed. At this time NLCS is still planning to have our graduation on Friday, July 24th at 7:30 p.m. Additional information will be updated on the NLCS website by Monday, July 20th at 3:00 p.m.

Mr. Todd Tanksley, BNL Principal
Dr. Ty Mungle, NLCS Superintendent

Needmore's Fourth Grade class celebrated the 100th Day of School in a "class voted" way. The students wanted to win 100 battles on Prodigy Math in 15 minutes. They figured out that each student will need to complete at least four battles. Students collaborated with peers to make sure they were successful. Some students worked on more battles to accommodate for our absent students. They kept each other accountable as they placed tally marks on the board. Students who completed the task, took the lead in giving the students a count of how many battles were left and the time. The class was successful in this endeavor!

In addition, students had the opportunity to look at some old, authentic textbooks that are at least 100 years old! #WeAreNLCS
